intro: Schanginia inderiensis, commonly known as the Inderian schangia, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep orange. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and have a velvety texture. Schanginia inderiensis is primarily found in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
